revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=TL-WDR4300 |revision=v1.1 |series=N750 |upc=845973051938 |asin=B0088CJT4U |est_release_date=06/13/2012 |fcc_date=06/06/2012 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=TE7WDR4300 |ic_id=8853A-WDR4300 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.1 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR9344 |cpu1_cspeed=560 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S25FL064KIF |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H5PS5162GFR |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9344 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=AR9580 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8327N |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |tp_firmware=OpenWrt,DD-WRT |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=C0:4A:00 |oui_eth=C0:4A:00 }} {{TagLine|N750 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Router}} :[http://www.tp-link.com/en/products/details/?categoryid=2166&model=TL-WDR4300 Product page] {{•}} [http://www.tp-link.com/resources/simulator/TL-WDR4300/Index.htm Firmware Interface] {{•}} [http://www.tplink.com/en/support/download/?model=TL-WDR4300&version=V1 Downloads]
See also the [[TP-LINK TL-WDR4310]] which shares the same hardware. :The '''Mercury''' MW4530R probably <small>([https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36534&p=3 on the '''OpenWrt Forums''']) :</small> also shares the same hardware (minus a USB port).
"2050500224 Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :A ''Genesys Logic'' [http://www.genesyslogic.com/en/product_view.php?show=21 GL850G] [[USB Host Controllers|USB 2.0 Hub controller]] is in use.
==Additional external links== *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/tp-link/tl-wdr4300 ''TP-Link TL-WDR4300'' on the '''OpenWrt Wiki'''] :"2050500231 Rev:1.0" is silkscreened on the board photo (v1.1). *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36534 ''TP-Link TL-WDR4310 v1.0 First Steps'' on the '''OpenWrt Forums'''] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=156445&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=30 ''Working build'' on '''DD-WRT Forum'''] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/other/ces-2012/31671-ces-2012-tp-link-announcements ''CES 2012: TP-Link Announcements'' - '''SmallNetBuilder''']
===HW Versions=== v1.7 * RAM: ''Zentel'' A3R1GE40CBF * Flash: ''Winbond'' W25Q64FVSIG v1.6 * RAM: ''Winbond'' W975166KB * Flash: ''Winbond'' W25Q64FVSIG
===PSU=== Power supplies, as shown in the FCC photos, are... *US: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-A1 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *Australia: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-A3 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *UK: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-B2 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A) *Euro: '''Leader Electronics''' MU18-2120150-C5 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 1.5A)
===JTAG=== AR9344 Support two JTAG modes: :Plain JTAG and EJTAG for debugging. To enable EJTAG mode you will need to remove :bootstrap resistor marked on this image: <gallery> File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140517 ejtag.jpg|EJTAG </gallery>
If u-boot is not damaged and you won't to experiment with EJTAG, :then you will need to disable at least /CS pin of SPI chip. :You can see it on this picture too.
==Images== <gallery caption="from TP-LINK"> File:TL-WDR4300-01.jpg|main File:TL-WDR4300-02.jpg|back File:TL-WDR4300-03.jpg|angled1 File:TL-WDR4300-04.jpg|angled2 File:TL-WDR4300-05.jpg|top </gallery>
<gallery caption="from Fishor"> File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140617.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140517.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140547.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160111 163809.jpg File:TL-WDR4300 20160115 140517 ejtag.jpg </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
